v.v: The vision of Isaiah son of Amoz, that he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
Hear, heavens, and give ear, earth; for Yahweh has spoken:
The ox knows his owner, and the donkey his master’s feeding trough,
Woe! Nation, sinners, a people weighed down with iniquity,
Why are you still being beaten? Why do you rebel more and more?
From the sole of the foot to the head there is no part unharmed;
Your country is ruined; your cities are burned;
The daughter of Zion is left like a hut in a vineyard,
If Yahweh of hosts had not left for us a small remnant,
Hear the word of Yahweh, you rulers of Sodom;
“What is the multitude of your sacrifices to me?” says Yahweh.
When you come to appear before me,
Bring no more meaningless offerings; incense is an abomination to me;
I hate your new moons and your appointed feasts;
So when you spread out your hands in prayer, I hide my eyes from you;
Wash, cleanse yourselves;
learn to do good;
“Come now, and let us reason together,” says Yahweh;
If you are willing and obedient, you will eat the good of the land,
but if you refuse and rebel, the sword will devour you,”
How the faithful city has become a prostitute!
Your silver has become impure, your wine mixed with water.
Your princes are rebels and companions of thieves;
Therefore this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel:
I will turn my hand against you,
I will restore your judges as at the first, and your counselors as at the beginning;
Zion will be redeemed by justice, and her repentant ones by righteousness.
Rebels and sinners will be crushed together, and those who abandon Yahweh will be done away with.
“For you will be ashamed of the sacred oak trees that you desired,
For you will be like an oak whose leaf fades,
The strong man will be like tinder, and his work like a spark;

“I have had enough of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fatted beasts;
and in the blood of bulls, lambs, or goats I do not delight.
who has required this of you, to trample my courts?
your new moon and Sabbath assemblies—I cannot tolerate these wicked assemblies.
they are a burden to me; I am tired of enduring them.
even though you offer many prayers, I will not listen;
your hands are full of blood.
remove the evil of your deeds from my sight;
stop being evil;
seek justice, make straight the oppression,
give justice to the fatherless, defend the widow.”
